resources.string: To view your router security rating, please click start

HNAP (Home Network Administration Protocol) is a network device management tool that can by used to change your device\'s security settings and even perform a factory reset by anyone with a bad intention. Many routers do no give the option to disable HNAP and some of the ones that do, don\'t actually turn off HNAP when you tell it to.

If you want to learn more about Router Security, I highly recommend checking out Michael Horowitz\'s website: http://routersecurity.org. Horowitz is one of the leading experts on Router Security. Also the article by Paul Wagenseil (http://www.tomsguide.com/us/home-router-security,news-19245.html) is very helpful on making your router more secure.

UPnP (Universal Plug-and-Play) is enabled on most of the commercial routers by default. There are many worms and malwares that can use this function to compromise the security of the entire local area network. You can test if your router has UPnP enabled by going to https://www.grc.com/x/ne.dll?bh0bkyd2

If you have adBlock or similar applications running, this application might not run properly. To continue with full functionality, please shut down adBlock and press OK. To continue with limited functionality, press cancel.
Port 32764 is a secret door left open on your router that can be used to take complete control of your router without a password.
